Rule2: Regarding the whale, if it has fewer than eight friends, then we can conclude that it holds an equal number of points as the turtle. Rule3: Regarding the whale, if it has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the lion's name, then we can conclude that it holds the same number of points as the turtle. Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the catfish become an enemy of the cricket?
proof: We know the whale is named Lucy and the lion is named Luna, both names start with "L", and according to Rule3 "if the whale has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the lion's name, then the whale holds the same number of points as the turtle", so we can conclude "the whale holds the same number of points as the turtle". We know the whale holds the same number of points as the turtle, and according to Rule1 "if at least one animal holds the same number of points as the turtle, then the catfish becomes an enemy of the cricket", so we can conclude "the catfish becomes an enemy of the cricket". So the statement "the catfish becomes an enemy of the cricket" is proved and the answer is "yes".
theory:
Facts:
	(lion, is named, Luna)
	(whale, has, 10 friends)
	(whale, is named, Lucy)
Rules:
	Rule1: exists X (X, hold, turtle) => (catfish, become, cricket)
	Rule2: (whale, has, fewer than eight friends) => (whale, hold, turtle)
	Rule3: (whale, has a name whose first letter is the same as the first letter of the, lion's name) => (whale, hold, turtle)
Preferences:
label: proved
